communes.name: City of Brussels
communes.watch_out_hint: Touristy pockets and traffic can feel noisy on weekends.

communes.name: Ixelles
communes.watch_out_hint: Popular streets get noisy on weekends; parking is often tight.

communes.name: Uccle
communes.watch_out_hint: Commute can be slower without a car; some pockets stretch budgets.

communes.name: Etterbeek
communes.watch_out_hint: Rents near EU quarter can be higher; traffic around main axes.

communes.name: Woluwe-Saint-Lambert
communes.watch_out_hint: Popular family areas book fast; prices can be above average.

communes.name: Woluwe-Saint-Pierre
communes.watch_out_hint: House-focused pockets are pricey; fewer nightlife options nearby.

communes.name: Auderghem
communes.watch_out_hint: Some areas feel suburban; check commute times to your daily anchors.

communes.name: Watermael-Boitsfort
communes.watch_out_hint: Limited nightlife; public transport varies by pocket, plan routes.

communes.name: Saint-Gilles
communes.watch_out_hint: Some streets are lively and noisy late; choose quieter side streets.

communes.name: Forest
communes.watch_out_hint: Quality varies by micro-area; visit at night before committing.

communes.name: Schaerbeek
communes.watch_out_hint: Very street-by-street; check safety/quietness around your exact block.

communes.name: Saint-Josse-ten-Noode
communes.watch_out_hint: Dense and busy; pick well-connected streets and avoid noisy intersections.

communes.name: Molenbeek-Saint-Jean
communes.watch_out_hint: Mixed pockets; choose established streets near metro and good lighting.

communes.name: Anderlecht
communes.watch_out_hint: Commune is large and varied; shortlist micro-areas before viewing.

communes.name: Evere
communes.watch_out_hint: Can feel more practical than charming; validate local cafes and parks.

communes.name: Jette
communes.watch_out_hint: Transit is good but depends on pocket; check last-mile walkability.

communes.name: Koekelberg
communes.watch_out_hint: Busy nodes around Simonis; pick calmer streets for day-to-day comfort.

communes.name: Ganshoren
communes.watch_out_hint: Smaller commune; fewer nightlife options, but good for quiet routines.

communes.name: Berchem-Sainte-Agathe
communes.watch_out_hint: More suburban feel; confirm commute and local amenities fit your needs.

tagging_pipeline.warning: Soft tags are not computed automatically.

microhoods_source.note: Official Monitoring des Quartiers quarters. Populated by compute_metrics_and_tags.py --include-microhoods.

Châtelain.why: Upscale local feel with boutiques, cafés and a walkable street grid; popular for young professionals and expats.
Châtelain.watch_out: Rents/prices are among the higher end; check parking availability and street noise near busy corners.

Flagey.why: Lively neighborhood around the ponds with strong café culture and easy access to Ixelles/Etterbeek.
Flagey.watch_out: Can get busy in the evenings and on weekends; some streets are noisier than others.

Parc Tenbosch.why: Quieter residential pocket near green space and close to Louise/Châtelain amenities.
Parc Tenbosch.watch_out: Availability can be limited; verify access to shops and public transport for your exact address.

Sainte-Alix.why: Calmer residential area often chosen by families for its green feel and larger homes.
Sainte-Alix.watch_out: Fewer nightlife/late-evening amenities; verify commute time to your key destinations.

Joli Bois.why: Leafier, more spacious feel with a strong residential character; good for those prioritizing quiet.
Joli Bois.watch_out: Less dense retail/cafés; public transport convenience varies by pocket.

Stockel.why: Residential hub with shops and day-to-day convenience; good base for families wanting calm streets and services nearby.
Stockel.watch_out: Competitive in prime pockets; check parking availability and the exact walk time to metro/tram.

Montgomery.why: Excellent connectivity (tram/metro links) and quick access to central corridors; convenient for commuters.
Montgomery.watch_out: Traffic/arterial roads can be noisy; shortlist streets away from main junctions.

Parc Elisabeth.why: Green anchor area with a calmer feel and good access toward Koekelberg/Jette.
Parc Elisabeth.watch_out: Street-by-street variation; confirm safety/ambience at night for your exact route.

Basilique.why: Distinct landmark zone with good access links and a more residential price point than prime central areas.
Basilique.watch_out: Some pockets feel less lively; check walkability to your preferred cafés/shops.

Koekelberg Centre.why: Practical, local-feel center with everyday amenities and relatively good value.
Koekelberg Centre.watch_out: Quality varies by building; pay attention to condition, charges, and renovation plans.

Fort Jaco.why: Leafy, upscale pocket with a village feel and quick access to green space; popular for families looking for calm streets.
Fort Jaco.watch_out: Public transport can be limited depending on the street; test school/run commute and check parking/traffic at peak hours.

Vivier D’oie.why: Quiet residential area near the city edge with a more 'suburban' feel and easy access to green paths.
Vivier D’oie.watch_out: Check access to daily shops without a car and confirm transit options for your exact address.

Saint - Job Kauwberg.why: Residential village-style pocket with access to green trails and a calmer pace; good for families prioritizing space.
Saint - Job Kauwberg.watch_out: Street-by-street variation: check evening noise, parking permit rules, and commute time to your daily destinations.

Kalevoet - Moensberg.why: Well-served by tram corridors with practical local amenities; often good value versus prime Ixelles/Uccle pockets.
Kalevoet - Moensberg.watch_out: Verify noise near tram/arteries and confirm building charges (syndic) and insulation (EPC).

Observatoire.why: Green-adjacent pocket with a residential feel and convenient links towards Louise/Ixelles.
Observatoire.watch_out: Availability can be tight; verify traffic/noise near main roads and parking options if you rely on a car.

Churchill.why: Premium residential zone with parks nearby and quick tram connections; attractive for families and many expats.
Churchill.watch_out: Prices can be high; validate total ownership cost and check street noise near main arteries.

Roodebeek.why: Practical, well-connected area around metro/tram corridors; strong commute option with nearby services.
Roodebeek.watch_out: Some streets are busier—do a peak-hour walk-through and check building noise/insulation.

Grand Place.why: Good starting point with strong metro connectivity, solid schools/childcare density, good café and brunch scene.
Grand Place.watch_out: Watch for busier evenings in lively pockets.

Dansaert.watch_out: Watch for busier evenings in lively pockets.

Beguinage - Dixmude.watch_out: Watch for busier evenings in lively pockets.
